entry.title: Driving Extensibility, Innovation and Automation with SAP Build's Clean Core
entry.content:
Below you'll find a summary of what was discussed during our latest Clean Core webinar, led by NTT Data, looking into ways to extend SAP environments and accelerate innovation through SAP Build's Clean Core methodology. 

🗓Agenda Highlights and session recap 🗓

  1. Current context: The importance of Clean Core in SAP S/4HANA modernization
    A Clean Core strategy keeps the SAP S/4HANA system free from heavy customizations that complicate upgrades. By reducing technical debt and streamlining updates, organizations gain more stability and agility. This approach lays the foundation for continuous innovation and smooth cloud adoption.

  2. Overview of SAP’s Side-by-Side extensibility strategy: Pro-Code and Low-Code/No-Code
    SAP's side-by-side extensibility allows organizations to innovate without modifying the core system. It offers both pro-code development for complex scenarios and low-code/no-code tools for business users. This ensures fast, secure innovation while keeping extensions isolated and easy to maintain.

  3. Tools and frameworks for Pro-Code and Low-Code/No-Code developers
    SAP BTP provides a unified set of tools supporting both professional developers and low-code/no-code creators. Pro-code users access advanced IDEs and SDKs, while business users work with visual development tools. Together, these frameworks accelerate development, enhance collaboration, and ensure secure, scalable extensions.

  4. Main components: Build Apps, Build Process Automation, and Build Work Zone
    The SAP Build suite includes three main elements that empower users across the organization. Build Apps enables rapid app creation, Build Process Automation streamlines workflows, and Build Work Zone centralizes access to applications and information. Combined, they create a cohesive digital workplace experience.

  5. Basic principles of SAP Build Apps
    SAP Build Apps focuses on visual, intuitive development to make app creation accessible to more users. It provides drag-and-drop tools, pre-built templates, and seamless integration with SAP and non-SAP systems. With cloud-native deployment and Fiori-aligned design, it supports user-friendly, governed, enterprise-ready innovation.

You can find in the link below the slides shared during the presentation with all of the content presented today by NTT Data. 

Link to presentation

 ⁉️Still curious about clean core? ⁉️

✅Contact your BTP Customer Success Manager for further discussion

✅ Visit SAP Discovery Center Missions on BTP

entry.title: Is AI Just a Power Tool for Enterprise Software?
entry.content:
We all remember that feeling – watching our friends build a little wood house next to the sandbox, marveling at how quickly they could assemble it with all the power tools available. Similarly, we can build a small tool shed in a weekend – a quick project with readily available resources. But try to build a 2-car garage, and suddenly the reality hits: it’s a vastly more complex undertaking. Even with every tool imaginable, you'd spend countless hours watching YouTube videos, improvising solutions, and inevitably missing crucial details – resulting in a structure that doesn’t meet the family council's standards.

That’s precisely how AI currently operates in enterprise software development. It can be an amazing “power tool” – accelerating routine tasks and suggesting code snippets. But it fundamentally cannot build a complex, robust software system on its own.

 

Let’s break down why. The garage analogy is a powerful one because it illustrates the difference between rapid assembly and true, lasting construction. AI can certainly suggest a quick solution for a simple function – like generating boilerplate code or completing a basic API endpoint. However, building a 2-car garage requires deep understanding of structural engineering, material science, and local building codes. Similarly, complex enterprise software projects demand architectural judgment, a comprehensive understanding of business requirements, and meticulous attention to detail – qualities that currently reside firmly with human developers.

AI coding assistants speed up routine tasks (boilerplate, suggestions, small functions) but lack long‑range architectural judgment, project context, and ownership required to run an entire project end-to-end. AI is used for bigger, more complex tasks, is introducing architectural anti‑patterns, duplication which result in maintainability and accelerating technical debt.

Responsibility of the code and using AI at the right time is still the coders responsibility. An expert knows "when to use what tool to get the right result.” Treating AI as a simple productivity booster – not an autonomous architect – is crucial.

Ultimately, building complex software requires a deep understanding of the business problem and a commitment to maintainability and scalability – qualities that are currently beyond the capabilities of AI. Just as you need a structural engineer to design a garage (or a house), developers need architectural expertise and rigorous testing to ensure the long-term success of any software project.

Don’t expect AI to build your garage (or House)– or your enterprise software system. Instead, view it as a valuable tool that can significantly enhance the productivity of skilled developers, but not replace them.

entry.title: Re: Translation for Custom Field (based on CBO) not refle...
entry.content:
Dear @jpriya,

I recreated your case in my environment and tell me if this is the effect you were looking for?

Goal: MultiLang F4 help (EN / IT) for a field in Manage Product Master Data app

  1. Create the field
    • App: Custom Fields
    • Business Context: Master Data: Product General (PRODUCT)
    • New field:
      • Type: Code List
      • Length: as needed

  1. Define list values (in your logon language, for example: English)
    • In the List Values section add rows:
      • Code Value: 01 – test, 02 - demo
    • Create and edit.

 

  1. Maintain translations for code descriptions
    • Open the same field again in Custom Fields app
    • Click Translation
    • Select target language IT Italian.
    • For each Code Value enter the Italian Description
    • Save the translations

 

 

  1. Add the field to the Product UI
    • App: Manage Product Master Data ->Adapt UI.
    • Save and publish the UI adaptation.
  2. Test and Result
    • Log on in English ->F4 shows English descriptions

 

    • Log on in Italian ->F4 shows Italian descriptions

 

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Smarter Built-In Support in C4C: A Unified and Upgraded Experience
entry.content:
Thanks for taking the time to share this. I really understand why the change feels disruptive, especially if you were used to handling everything inside C4C without ever needing SAP for Me. The extra step of customer authorization can feel inconvenient at first, but it is worth remembering that using S-users has always been a requirement, particularly whenever you need support access on a tenant you cannot log into. Another positive and important aspect, which was not mentioned in the blog, is that your cases will now remain available even if you refresh or move your tenant, which was not possible before.

It is also important to say that the previous Built-In Support platform was outdated with no possibility of improvement and was affected by synchronization issues that caused real problems for many customers. This was one of the key reasons why we needed to move to a more reliable foundation, a foundation that is used in multiple SAP solutions.

Just to clarify, this is not a full shift to SAP for Me. You can still create and manage your own cases directly within the application. For managing all cases created by other admin users, aligning C4C with the broader SAP support platform now gives you access to the full case management capabilities of SAP for Me, including far better reporting, clearer escalation paths, and a much more reliable overall experience.

I really appreciate your feedback, it helps us support everyone better through the transition.
